fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Headings are being duplicated on *Table of Contents Macro* if placed inside a table.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and insert a *Table of Contents* macro;
# Add a table with just a single cell;
 # Inside this cell type any text and add a Heading 1 formatting to it (heading 2 or 3 will also do);
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* Table of Contents to display this text as a single entry;

h3. Actual Results
* Heading is actually duplicated, as can be seen in this next screenshot.

 !Screen Shot 2020-07-22 at 11.36.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
(/) Place the Heading text outside of the table cell and you should be good to go :D
fields.summary: Headings are being duplicated on Table of Content Macro if placed inside a table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page Property report macro renders page information in different rows if multiple page property macro is used on a page. So basically if a three page-properties macro is used in a page, On *page property report macro* instead of showing the entire summary in one row, it's showing up in three different rows.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with page property macro.
 # Add a table with two columns, make the left column as a header.
 # Add some information to it.
 # Add two more page property macro on the same page. (repeat steps 2 and 3)
 # Create another page and add page property report macro

h3. Expected Results

It should show all the page information in one row for that page.
h3. Actual Results

It's rendering the page information in three different rows.
 However, preview mode looks clean (showing information in a single row)
 !image-2020-07-22-18-28-00-064.png|thumbnail! 
 But once the macro is saved on the page or published the page, it shows 
 !image-2020-07-22-18-28-38-566.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-07-22-18-29-00-805.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
 The only workaround is to merge all the column heading in one table/one-page property macro
fields.summary: Page Property report macro renders page information in different rows if multiple page property macro is used on a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The [Confluence Query Language|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/confluence-search-syntax/#] should be a great way to user the search feature on Confluence. It has great potential to increase value to the product.
Though we have a documentation listing tips of how to use it, some of the CQLs don't work properly, like the {{macroName}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert an *Excerpt Include* macro in a page;
# Go to the Confluence Advanced Search;
# In the search bar, type {{macroName:excerpt-include}} and hit enter.

h3. Expected Results
The search results show us all pages with that macro, including the new one we just created.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence only shows pages that contain the word "_include_" in the title or body.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: CQL for search pages with macro not consistently working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * No archived spaces are being returned from the Space Directory when the field is selected
 * Upon selecting a specific category in the list there are no spaces listed.
 * Clicking on the links for SIte SPaces or Personal Spaces does not filter for one or the other and displays the same content as the link for AllSpaces.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to space directory
 # click on archived spaces.
 # select on any categories in the list.

h3. Expected Results

Space directory should list the archived spaces and list the spaces based on the specified category.
h3. Actual Results

The space list shows empty and personal spaces and site space list all the spaces without differentiating.
h3. Workaround

 Either use the direct URL or space permission to list the archived space. For the non-admin who cannot list all spaces, they can see archived spaces via following Rest API as mentioned below:
{code:java}
/wiki/rest/api/space?status=archived{code}
  and form the list take the space key and replace in the URL.   
{code:java}
 e.g: /wiki/spaces/PERM{code}
fields.summary: Unable to view Archived Spaces in Space Directory

fields.description:
When editing documents, I copy/paste quite often, usually including a text block (note) and a table.  After saving, the document is not always formatted as expected.  For example, the space between the bottom of one table and the text block below it is not right.  No matter how many blank lines I insert in the editor, it ignores all that whitespace and has no vertical spacing between the blocks.

But it's not consistent.  In some places, there are two blank lines (as I typed in my document), and in other places, there are no blank lines (as described above).  After inspecting the underlying HTML, I see that, in the cases where the vertical spacing is ignored, it's because a <div> has been added with a class of "table-wrap" that encloses the text block and the table together.

It's extremely frustrating when those are inserted, because it is virtually impossible to get rid of them.  If I try to grab only the text block and paste it "outside" the "table-wrap", and do the same with the table itself, I just get additional table-wrap divs.

I can't see the need for that wrapping div, so please remove that "feature".
fields.summary: Stop adding table-wrap "behind the scenes"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the *Page Properties Report* and *Content By Label* macros are not returning pages outside of the current space of the report page. When checking this macro on a page an error "No content found" is displayed, even if all its fields are correctly configured.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on *space X*> insert a *Page Properties* (or *Content By Label*) macro, and add a label to the page (e.g. 'test') > Publish page.
 # Create another page on *space Y*> insert a *Page Properties Report* macro and report on the label you just used on the previous page (e.g. 'test');
 # Either Publish the page or check it on edit mode.

h3. Expected Results
 * Pages with the 'test' label to be displayed on *Page Properties Report*/*Content By Label*.

h3. Actual Results
 * No result is returned and a message *{{No content found}}* / *{{There is no content with the specified labels}}* is displayed, similar to the screenshot below.
 * This only affect pages that are not on the same space as the report page

!Screen Shot 2020-07-21 at 17.14.51.png|thumbnail!

(!) _This affects both the New and Legacy editor alike._ (!)
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page Properties Report and Content By Label won't return pages outside of the Current Space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the old editor, it was possible to place the Page Properties macro inside an Excerpt, Expand, Section, Column or a Panel macro macro. However, the Page Properties Report macro won't display content from this page, on its report.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page (for example *Test page - old editor*) using the old editor.
 # Place an Excerpt, or a Panel macro on the page.
 # Place a Page Properties macro inside the Excerpt.
 # Publish *Test page - old editor*.
 # Add a label on the page (for example, *test*).
 # Create another page (for example *Test page*).
 # Place the Page Properties macro.
 # Publish *Test page*.
 # Add a label on the page (for example, *test*).
 # Create another page (for example, *Report*).
 # Place the Page Properties Report macro, and configure to use the *test* label.
 # Publish *Report*.

h3. Expected Results

The Page Properties Report macro should display content from both pages (*Test page - old editor* and *Test page*).
h3. Actual Results

The Page Properties report won't include content from pages in which the Page Properties macro is inside an Excerpt macro.
h3. Workaround

Placing the Page Properties macro outside the Excerpt would fix the issue.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro can't display content if the Page Properties macro is placed inside an Excerpt, Expand, Section, Column  or a Panel macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Search for users REST API is not returning the correct number of total search results so it is not possible to know from the search response whether there are more paginated results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a call to `rest/api/search/user?cql=type=user&limit=n` where n is set to 2
 # Repeat the previous step, but with a higher number for n

h3. Expected Results
`totalSize` should be set to the number of results that exist for the search query, not the number of results returned

h3. Actual Results
Regardless of what is passed in for `limit`, the `totalSize` returned is always incorrect (i.e. usually just matches the number of results returned)

h3. Workaround
Keep requesting the next set of search results until there are no more
fields.summary: Search for users REST API returns incorrect totalSize

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*:
 Page property report macro not showing results:

*Replication steps*:
 1. Create 2 pages in old editor, page Test_a, Test_b and create one-page "Test_C" in the new editor.
 2. Go to page Test_a, Insert a page properties macro inside panel macro.

3. Go to page Test_b, insert a page properties macro without panel macro.

4. Add label pro on both pages.
 5. Go to "Test_C" and insert a page properties report macro and configure macro with label pro.

*Expected result*:
 Page properties report macro should show both the pages Test_a Test_b

*Actual result*:
 Page properties report macro doesn’t show the pages which have page properties macro inside panel macro, only Test_b page is showing in the page properties macro.

*Workaround*
At this moment, there isn't an workaround available for this bug.
fields.summary: Page Property report macro not showing page summary information.

fields.description:
I'm really frustrated by the list numbering capability in Confluence.  There is no capability that I can find to control how lists are numbered.  If I break the sequence to put in something that I don't wish to be numbered, for example an additional explanation or a screen print.  The numbering starts again, and I can't find any way to adjust the numbering.  Something I can do easily in other software.

If I try to manually enter the numbers, Jira automatically starts creating a list at number 1, using a different format and indent.  But it won't automatically create the list entries for 2 and beyond if I start to enter them.

I use Confluence to create user documentation.  I'm currently a Product Manager for Software, and have been writing user documentation for supply chain software for over 25 years.
fields.summary: Numbered Lists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the page properties report macro, if you filter the columns to show and the column name is between quotes, it does not show up the columns in the Published page, however, on the preview of the macro it is showing up normally.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a properties macro report
 # Create another page with a properties macro
 # On the properties macro report, use the label corresponding and filter the columns, one having the name written as *column A* and the other *"column B"*  (quotes required)
 # Preview the macro content
 # Save
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The information shown on the preview for the page properties report is the same on the published page.
h3. Actual Results

Columns with the quotes (*"")*  on its name in the columns to show option show up on the preview macro, however, are not showing on the published page.
h3. Workaround

Remove the quotes *""* from the column's name on the filter columns to show on the page properties report.
fields.summary: Page properties report macro is not showing columns on published page if they have quotes on the column to show filter, but it does on the preview macro

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition

h4. Suggested Resolution

If the search term appears multiple times on a page, the results should specify, for example:
{quote}Occurs X times on page
{quote}
Ideally, you would be able to then jump to results on the page, much like you do when searching for a term in a browser using CTRL/CMD+F.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 27 October 2021}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your patience as we work on fixing this bug. 

We’re currently making some larger architectural changes to PDF Export that should resolve this bug (and many other PDF export related issues). While this is set to fully release for spaces in early 2022, this GIF problem should be resolved at least for page level exports in Q4 2021. We acknowledge that this has run into delays as the development team wants to ensure that we will not regress on functionality with the architectural improvements.

We know you have been waiting eagerly for this fix as we are, and we will be providing any updates as they come. Thank you again for your patience.

Best,

Steven
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

In some cases, a specific attachment (PNG or GIF) will prevent the page and the entire space from being exported to PDF.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert the GIF or PNG image (we were only able to reproduce this using specific GIFs and specific PNG images)
 # Set the image to a lower pre-defined size (small or medium)
 # Publish the page
 # Try to export the page or the entire space to PDF

h3. Expected Results

It should export the page/ space without problems
h3. Actual Results

The following error is thrown, generally at 50% for the export:
{code:none}
There was an error in the export. Please check your log files.{code}
h3. Workaround

There're three available workarounds:
 *For the new editor*:
 * Individually export the affected page instead of using the space export.

*For both editors*:
 * Remove the image or replace it with a different image (other than the affected GIF/PNG)
 * Set the image to its original size or a manual value - it seems to fail only with the preset sizes (small, medium) (Legacy editor only)
fields.summary: Can't export pages/spaces to PDF with specific GIF/PNG images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [get content properties API|#api-api-content-id-property-get]] returns inconsistent results. For further context, see [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/rest-api-changes-for-content-properties/39894].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log into a Confluence tenant and visit any page.
 # From the URL, extract the content ID.
 # Visit [tenant-base]/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/property and observe the response JSON.
 # Visit [tenant-base]/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/property?expand=version and observe the response JSON.
 # Visit [tenant-base]/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/property?expand=content and observe the response JSON.
 # Wait 10 minutes.
 # Visit [tenant-base]/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/property?expand=content and observe the response JSON.
 # Visit [tenant-base]/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/property?expand=version and observe the response JSON.
 # Visit [tenant-base]/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/property and observe the response JSON.

h3. Expected Results

All responses are in accordance with the [API documentation|#api-api-content-id-property-get]].
h3. Actual Results
 # The responses for steps 3, 4 and 5 are identical. They all include expanded version information, even though this should not be provided for 5 where expand=content.
 # The response for step 7 is correct (includes expanded content).
 # The response for step 8 is an internal error (500 status code).
 # The response for step 9 is an internal error (500 status code).

h3. Workaround

"Get content properties" API can be used instead of "Get content property"
fields.summary: Retrieving content properties from the REST API returns inconsistent results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When 'Content by Label' used within a table having more than 5 columns and if the macro is empty then the message will not be wrapped rather elongated within the cell, making the layout look terrible. 
h3. Environment

Fabric Editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page in Fabric Editor
 # Create a table with 5 columns
 # Add macro 'Content by Label' in any two cells
 # Edit settings for macro and add any non-existent label.
 # Save macro settings and you will see "Content by Label" (pulled from the text when the macro is empty)
 # Publishing the page will show the layout with elongated text

h3. Expected Result

The message should be wrapped properly within the cell.

h3. Actual Results

The message is not wrapped.
h3. Notes:

If we have less than 5 columns then we can increase the width of the table while publishing the page and it will nicely wrap the message.
fields.summary: 'Content by Label' macro doesn't wrap text message when used in table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A certain set of page properties (likely containing dates) may trigger an error when trying to sort, most likely because a Comparator isn't upholding transitivity with property objects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Exact values required to reproduce the issue are unknown, will likely need to be reverse-engineered by looking at the Comparator class. Currently the best way to reproduce is:
 # Create many pages with page properties with at least one column that has primarily datetime objects. Label all the pages.
 # Use the page properties report macro and report on the pages, be sure to use the macro configuration options and set to sort by your column that contains mostly dates.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking Load more on advanced search results expands to the same list of content as seen on the previous search results page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Use advanced search filters to search for all content by a particular contributor in a certain date range with no query text.
 # Step 2 Scroll to the bottom of the search results page and click on Load more

h3. Expected Results

Load the next search results page should show the next batch of search results and NOT repeat the same search results already shown previously
h3. Actual Results

Load the next search results page showed the same search results already shown previously.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced search result page Load more is showing repetitive search results
Removing personal space permissions for its owner fails without information
Contributors macro doesn't work with Page Properties Report

fields.description:
Currently on the new editor, the expand macro has a field "title" where it was not present on the legacy editor.

It would be useful to have the title customizable, such as being able to make the title bold, change title's color or even add headings to the title, so users could use the linkable headings to it.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the Expand macro's title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to our [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/edit-a-global-template/], Confluence administrators are supposed to be able to edit Global Templates properly. However, if the user performs any change on the *Snapshot JIRA Report* template, it won't work properly anymore. The user is still able to use it to create new pages, however the information from the selected Jira project doesn't populate on the page anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence.
 # Click on the cog icon, on the top right corner.
 # Click on *Global Templates and Blueprints*, on the sidebar.
 # Click on *Edit* button, next to the *Snapshot JIRA Report Template*.
 # Perform any edit on the template (you can simply add a *.* anywhere on it).
 # Click on *Save* on the top right corner.
 # Click on *Create* button, on the top navigation bar.
 # Search for *Jira Report* template.
 # Select *Change log*.
 # Select the desired Jira project.
 # Provide a title to the page.
 # Click on *Create* button.

h3. Expected Results

Jira project information should populate on the page's content. 
h3. Actual Results

The template will load however the Jira content won't be populated on it.
h3. Workaround

The workaround would be to reset the template to its default. To do so, navigate back to the *Global Templates and Blueprints*, and click on *Reset to default*, next to the template's name.
fields.summary: Editing the Snapshot JIRA Report Template will cause it to stop working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to fetch all the attachments from  !image-2020-07-10-12-03-29-945.png|thumbnail! space if it has more than 10K attachments.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Space where mote than 10k attachments is linked.
 # It will not let you view attachments past 10K

h3. Expected Results
It should paginate to see attachment past 10k

h3. Actual Results
it displays : 
{code:java}
There are currently no attachments in this space.
{code}

h3. Workaround
This CQL REST query should support going past 10k all the way to 100k, hopefully, it will meet the customer's needs:
https://https://sitename.atlassian.net//wiki/rest/api/content/search?limit=50&start=10000&cql=space=%22Spacekey%22%20AND%20type=attachment%20ORDER%20BY%20id
More details using CQL can be found here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/advanced-searching-using-cql/
fields.summary: Unable to fetch all the attachments from a space if it has more than 10K attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 Application Link between JIRA Server & Confluence Cloud not showing JIRA Issue Summary /Status in Confluence Cloud
 It returns an error Issued_ID- Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Configure App Link between Jira Server and Confluence Cloud
* User A creates a page A in Confluence
* User A adds  /Jira macro to the page
* User A publish the page
* User A can see the Jira issues and its Summary
* User B displays the Page A 
* User B has full permission to view all the issue in Jira server but cant see the Issue details on Confluence page . It is getting an error Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error
* User B if clicks on the actual Issue link can view the issue


h3. Expected Results

User B should be able to see the Issue Summary / Status on the Confluence page
h3. Actual Results

User B cant see the Issue Summary / Status  It is getting an error Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error

h3. Workaround

* User B adds a new /Jira macro to the page and log in again 
* User B refreshes the page 
* User B now can see correct data
fields.summary: Application Link between JIRA Server & Confluence Cloud not showing JIRA Issue Summary /Status in Confluence Cloud It returns an error Issued_ID- Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On page with *JIRA* macro - Pie. Chart, if this macros takes too much time to return results, the page can't display the Jira Pie Chart, with a 504 http response after  1- 3 minutes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in the new editor
# Add around 100 or more *JIRA Issue/Filter* and choose to show on the Pie Chart 
# Set their filters to be complex ones or to return a high number of results, in such a way that they will take some seconds to return results
# Publish the page 

h3. Expected Results
The page should show the Jira Pie Chart

h3. Actual Results
After waiting around 2 minutes, the following error is shown:
{quote}com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Can not retrieve jira chart
{quote}
or a com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException:, but with a timeout error.


h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira Pie Chart Macro timing out and not rendering on the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Issue/Filter macro does not default to System Jira when other instances are linked on application link. This happens when there's an external Jira instance set as *Primary* and even after removing this instance, this behavior will persist with non-primary external instances.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new instance with just Confluence;
 # Link 5 external Jira instances > Make one of those the primary one by clicking *...* on the right-hand side > *Make Primary*
 # Enable Jira on this instance;
 # Create a Jira Issue/Filter on this instance - The macro will not default to the system Jira. (if System Jira is correctly selected follow the next steps)
 # Remove the Primary instance from application links.
# Create a Jira Issue/Filter on this instance - The macro will not default to the system Jira. 

h3. Expected Results
* Jira Issue/Filter Macro to default to System Jira

h3. Actual Results
* Jira Issue/Filter Macro will continue to default to external instances even though the Primary external instance was removed.

 !Screen Shot 2020-07-09 at 15.22.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
(/) Remove all application links from this instance and reassociate them again. This way when you create a new Jira Issue/Filter macro it will correctly default to System Jira
fields.summary: Jira Issue/Filter macro does not default to System Jira when other instances are linked on application link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Issue/Filter macro won't allow users to select other macros when clicking *Select Macro* button on the bottom left corner of the pop-up screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page (or template);
 # Type (or select from the drop-down menu) /*jira*
 # The Macro will be inserted into the page, now click on *Select Macro*;
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-09 at 09.42.14.png|width=643,height=450!

h3. Expected Results
 * User to be able to select other macros;

h3. Actual Results
 * By clicking *Select Macro* the page will go a bit darker for a very quick while, and won't allow users to select other macros, as can be seen in this next GIF:

 

!Screen Recording 2020-07-09 at 09.35 AM.gif!

 
(!) *_Note_* this seems to only affect Jira Issue/filter macro on both regular pages and templates

h3. Workaround
(/) Manually select other macros by either typing their name or using the drop-down menu, instead of using the *Select Macro* button.
fields.summary: Jira Issue/Filter macro won't allow users to select other macros when clicking Select Macro button

fields.description:
When I go to add a link in Fabric, it insists on changing my text to a widget with the name of the page I'm linking to. Instead, the default should be to preserve the text I've selected.

As a workaround, I can use Ctrl+Z to get the text I want, but it's awkward to have to do so.

Why can't Fabric be like every normal rich text editor on the planet? Creating these widget/card things should *not* be the default behavior.

More generally, I feel like Fabric is constantly fighting me and violating every established usage paradigm of text editing. Please study other text editors (including the legacy Confluence editor which was decent) and rationalize the behavior.

 

!image-2020-07-09-20-14-54-429.png|width=666,height=341!
fields.summary: Fabric Editor: Link creation is unnatural

fields.description:
A few versions back in confluence I was able to add Emoji to page names and they showed up just right as you would expect them to look like. No, since a few weeks, the sidebar slices off some parts off Emojis and in Chrome the whitespace between Emoji and text becomes so dense that the Emoji seems to touch or even overlay the text. Please fix this.

Safari Screenshot

!https://i.imgur.com/K1lleD5.png!

Chrome Screenshot

 !https://i.imgur.com/CYf4mBy.png!
fields.summary: Properly support Emoji in page names again

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting a team Calendars macro on the edit mode of a page, there is an option to add a new calendar, instead of searching for an existing calendar on the space.

Upon clicking on the button add new calendar, if there is already one created calendar on the space, it fails to create a new calendar and the macro preview disappears as it was not even inserted on the page.

If there is no calendars created on the space, upon clicking to add a new calendar, the create calendar dialogue shows up, but after inserting the information to create the calendar, it doesn't conclude the process and the button is greyed out with "Adding..." message, however, the calendar was already created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Scenario A*:
# Create a new page
# Make sure to have no calendars on the space
# Add the team calendars macro
# Click on "add a new calendar" on the macro preview

*Scenario B*:
Steps to Reproduce if there is already an existing calendar on the space
# Create a new page
# Make sure to have calendars on the space
# Add the team calendars macro
# Click on "add a new calendar" on the macro preview

h3. Expected Results
The add a new calendar button creates a new calendar on the space.

h3. Actual Results
*Scenario A*:
If there is no calendars on the space, the creation calendar is shown, but it doesn't show the macro properly after creating the calendar nor returns the message that the calendar was created.

*Scenario B*: 
If there is an existing calendar on the space, the add calendar button on the macro preview doesn't work and closes the macro preview and it disappears from the edit page
*OR*
After inserting the information of the new calendar, the create calendar macro pop-up will get stuck in the "_Adding_" status and will never close up.

h3. Workaround

Create a new calendar directly on the Calendar's space shortcut page
*OR*
Refresh the page and call the team calendar macro again - then, you will be able to add the calendar you just created.
fields.summary: Adding a new calendar from within the team Calendars macro is not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachments don't load in the comment section if the page/space is imported.
*Cloud to Cloud:*
When the Space is exported and imported:
The attachments in the comment section do not load.
 !image-2020-07-08-16-35-07-568.png|thumbnail! 

When the page is exported and imported:
The attachments do not appear or say attachments in the comments section are not exported along.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Export the page from one cloud instance to another.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment should load and appear well in the comment section after the import.

h3. Actual Results
When the Space is exported and imported:
The attachments in the comment section do not load.
 !image-2020-07-08-16-35-07-568.png|thumbnail! 

When the page is exported and imported:
The attachments do not appear or say attachments in the comments section are not exported along.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Drag and Drop of Attachments do not work in Confluence. If a file is dragged and dropped in the box, it either opens up or downloads the file. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page.
 # Add *Attachments* macro to it.
# Drag and drop and file in the 'drag and drop' box.

h3. Expected Results
The file should be uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
The file either opens up or gets downloaded.

h3. Workaround
Use the "Choose file" button to open the file navigator in the computer. Then, select a file and proceed with the upload of the attachment.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop of Attachments do not work in Confluence
Using ` as a keyboard shortcut in Finnish keyboard layout doesn't handle markup properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The space export download is incomplete.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space export.
 # Download the export file.

h3. Expected Results

If the space export file is 1.4 GB the downloaded file also should be of the same size.
h3. Actual Results

The download shows the total attachment size, but the download is terminated early, which results in a corrupted file. 

For example: If the total file size was 1.4 GB the downloaded file was 300 MB.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Backup Downloads Resulting in Corrupted Backups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Webhooks can't be defined using the space_property_equal_to condition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Define a webhook as follows:

 
{noformat}
"webhooks": [ { "event": "page_created", "url": "/rest/webhook/page/page_created", "conditions": [ { "condition": "space_property_equal_to", "params": { "propertyKey": "app_prop_name", "objectName": "key", "value": "true" } } ] } ]
{noformat}
 
h3. Expected Results

The descriptor is valid.
h3. Actual Results

Installation failed. The app includes a Webhook module with an unsupported condition (space_property_equal_to).
h3. Workaround

Define the webhook as:
{noformat}
"webhooks": [ { "event": "page_created", "url": "/rest/webhook/page/page_created", "conditions": [ { "condition": "entity_property_equal_to", "params": { "entity": "space", "propertyKey": "app_prop_name", "objectName": "key", "value": "true" } } ] } ]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Defining a webhook with space_property_equal_to condition fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you convert a page which has indented Heading inside an expand macro to the new editor, the conversion will happen, however the page's content will be replaced by an *unsupported content* message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the Legacy editor.
 # Place an expand macro.
 # Place a Heading text inside the expand macro.
 # Indent the Heading.
 # Publish the page.
 # Edit the page.
 # A message that the page can be converted will be displayed. Click on *Preview page* button.
 # Click on *Preview*.

h3. Expected Results

The page's content should be converted.
h3. Actual Results

Page's content is replaced by below message:

!image-2020-07-06-19-51-58-897.png|width=873,height=79!
h3. Workaround

Before converting the page, outdent the Heading text inside the expand macro.
fields.summary: Converting a page with indented headings inside an expand macro will break the page

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results

Response status code of 403
h3. Actual Results

 
{noformat}
Response status code of 500 due to unhandled 401 status code{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there's no way to modify or hide the top navigation bar from anonymous users and JIRA Service Desk customer.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to modify and/ or hide the navigation bar from anonymous users and JIRA Service Desk customer.
fields.summary: Ability to hide the top navigation bar from anonymous users

fields.description:
When [moving a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/], if it includes a draft as its child and the target space already has a page with the same title as the draft, the following message will be displayed:

{quote}
"The page 'Example page' already exists in space 'Example space'.
{quote}

As it is only a draft, there will have no way for the user to find it out if the page has a different author. If the user is the author, this will require extra effort to find the draft under the *Drafts* tab of Confluence's home dashboard.

h3.Suggestion

To make it a smooth experience, some suggestion:

* The message could clarify that this is a draft, like "a draft already exists in "Example space"" 
* The message could point a link to the draft or any page being moved.
fields.summary: Improve message when moving a draft to a different space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the documentation [Configure Time and Date Formats|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/configure-time-and-date-formats/], it does not clarify that this does _not_ update the format in the Date Macro.

The Date Macro lozenge format is based on the language of the site, and is not affected by configuring the Java date/time. This is confusing and causes customers to raise support tickets and questions on Community about it.
h3.  
h3. Suggested Solution

Clarify on documentation that this does not update the Date Macro lozenge. The current feature request for this is below:

CONFCLOUD-35168
fields.summary: In configure time and date format documentation, clarify that it does not modify Date Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Chart Macro does not render in published mode if entries are put using JIRA macro 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and use Chart Macro in it. 
# Create a table and in each column enter JIRA issue count using JIRA issue macro.

preview mode:

h3. Expected Results
The chart should be visible in the published mode as well. 

h3. Actual Results
The chart isn't appearing on the published page. 


h3. Workaround

fields.summary: Chart Macro does not render in published mode if entries are put using JIRA macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The editor doesn't work properly due to an error below:
{quote}*This page has failed to load*
 Our team has been notified. Wait a few minutes and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support.
 Error details: Failed to fetch
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the editor in any page

h3. Expected Results

The page is editable.
h3. Actual Results

Browser console error: TBD
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incident: unable to edit pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For context, also see [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/ap-resize-does-not-work-in-resorted-page-properties-reports/39074].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dynamic macro with inline output type.
 # Insert this macro as a value (not key) inside a table in a “Page Properties” macro.
 # Create a page with a “Page Properties Report” which includes the one created before.
 # AP.resize still works as expected for the macro inside the report.
 # Re-sort the Page Properties report by any column.
 # Invoke the functionality that is dependent on AP.resize.

h3. Expected Results

At step 6, the macro is resized as per the AP.resize call.
h3. Actual Results

At step 6, the macro is NOT resized.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Sorting page properties reports breaks JavaScript API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a page, and then while on edit mode moves it to another Space, you won't be able to publish. Below error message will be displayed:

!image-2020-07-03-19-54-53-030.png|width=369,height=60!

*Note:* This bug affects copied pages too. If you create a copy, and then moves it before publishing it, the same behavior will happen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence.
 # Click on *Create* to create a new page.
 # Add content to the draft.
 # Click on the three ellipses on the top right corner > *Move page*.
 # Select another Space and parent page.
 # Click on *Save*.
 # Click on *Publish*.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be published as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Bellow error message is displayed:

!image-2020-07-03-20-00-22-119.png|width=369,height=60!

On the browser console -> Network tab, there's a request with 400 status, and below response:
{code:java}
{"statusCode":400,"data":{"authorized":false,"valid":true,"errors":[],"successful":false},"message":"com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: Can't add a parent from another space."} {code}
h3. Workaround

Hard refreshing the page (*ctrl + F5 on Windows / command + shift + R on Mac*) will work. However, note that the draft may load without its title.
fields.summary: Unable to move a page before publishing it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you re-name an Instance, the links for pages on edit mode will break on your pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create *Page 1*.
 # Access *Page 1* on edit mode, and copy its link.
 # Create *Page 2*, and place the link to edit *Page 1* on Page 2's body.
 # Re-name the Instance.

h3. Expected Results

The smartlink for *Page 1* should still work on Page 2.
h3. Actual Results

The smartlink won't load the page title anymore. Instead, the raw link is displayed:

!image-2020-09-16-11-50-44-631.png!
h3. Workaround

Updating the link to the new Instance name will fix the issue.
fields.summary: Renaming an Instance will break smartlinks for pages on edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pages that contains diacritic characters are missing the characters/letters on the URL.
If a page title has no accent on it, the title is normal.
For example:
Title: "Irón" 
https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacename>/pages/<pageid>/ir+n
Title: iron
https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacename>/pages/<pageid>/iron

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page or rename one with a diacritic character, for example "irón"
 # Publish the page
# Check the URL
# Create another page, without the diacritic character, for example, "iron"
# Check the URL again

h3. Expected Results
Both URLs are showing up with its title name.

h3. Actual Results

The page title containing the diacritic character is missing one letter or having a "+" on its place.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages with diacritic characters are missing the characters/letters on the URL

fields.description:
The Google Chrome browser offers a lot of tracking options - more than other browsers (Internet Explorer or Mozilla Firefox).
Confluence cloud application uses too much of this tracking when it detects the Chrome browser.
The network which does not allow tracking, the user logins are permanently rejected by Confluence Cloud on chrome.
fields.summary: Confluecne to ignore tracking and enable logging

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pages with the title containing diacritic characters are not showing up on search, unless you use the word with the character on the search.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page or rename one with a diacritic character, for example "qué"
 # Publish the page
# Search for the page without the accent character, for example "que"
# Search again, but using the word "qué"


h3. Expected Results
Both search will return the page qué on the results

h3. Actual Results
It only returns the page "qué", if the search is using the "qué" instead of showing on the search as well when using the "que".

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages with diacritic characters are not showing up on search

fields.description: It would be useful to have a way to see what was changed on a page (based on the page history) when a Jira issue macro is updated, as it does not count towards the page version when it updates itself.
fields.summary: Ability to see whats changed on the page history when using a Jira issue macro

fields.description:
User should have option to remove/disable/configure search bar in confluence.

 !image-2020-07-03-17-31-05-310.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to disable or configure Embedded search Bar in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an anonymous user edits a page, "Something went wrong" error message is displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Grant all permission to anonymous users
 # Access to a page and click [edit] button as an anonymous user

h3. Expected Results
The editor is opened.

h3. Actual Results
"Something went wrong" error is displayed.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-07-03 16.18.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Something went wrong error when an anonymous user edit a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing Confluence and viewing pages, the following message is displayed at the bottom of the sidebar:

!expired.png|thumbnail!

In specific scenarios, the following issue is also displayed, blocking the page tree to be loaded:

!wrong.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Simply access a Confluence page in a space.

h3. Expected Results
No errors should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
A "*Session expired. Please reload the page*" message is displayed at the bottom of the page tree. Sometimes, the page tree itself does not load as well with the "*Something went wrong* message following it.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Session expired while viewing Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the new editor, when setting the field *Sort by* on a page properties report macro, it will display an error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some pages and properly configure a page properties macro on them
# use the same label for those pages
# Create a new page and add a page properties report macro, setting the previous label
# Set the *Sort by* field to be any of the columns
# Save the macro and publish the page

h3. Expected Results
It should properly display the report

h3. Actual Results
It throws the following error:
{code:none}Error while fetching page properties report data{code}


h3. Workaround
Remove the column from the *Sort by* field from the page properties report, save the macro and publish the page.
fields.summary: "Error while fetching page properties report data" on page properties report

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Team Calendars is failing to subscribe to a Calendar through URL or import the same if the has a line break  on its Summary on the .ics file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get a link to import or subscribe to a calendar, from PagerDuty for example (Make sure to have a long title on its calendar)
 # Try to subscribe to the calendar  or
# Download the Calendar from the link
# Try to import it on the instance


h3. Expected Results
The Calendar is imported successfully or subscribed through the link.

h3. Actual Results
If the Calendar has a line break, the import fails, same thing happens on the subscribe through the link, the error "Specified calendar does not seem like iCalendar" returns on the UI.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
{success: false,…}
fieldErrors: [{field: "location", errorMessages: ["Specified calendar does not seem like iCalendar."]}]
success: false
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Edit the .ics Calendar file and remove the line break on the Summary and then import it on Team Calendars.
fields.summary: Team Calendars is failing to import or subscribe to a Calendar

fields.description:
*Summary:* Hide Tabs from the navigation bar from the portal customer

Elaboration: JIRA Service Desk Customer should not see tabs (*Home, Recent, Apps, Create, Space Settings*) on the navigation bar if they access the confluence KB/Space/Page.
 !image-2020-07-02-14-58-14-078.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hide Tabs from the navigation bar from the portal customer

fields.description:
Issue Summary

Ability to display only selected Epics with Jira roadmap macro on the Confluence page.

For example Project, ABC has got 3 Epics ( Epic1, Epic2 and Epic3). At the moment when you select project ABC in the *Jira roadmap* Macro, it shows all the 3 Epics. Customer wants to have the ability to select and display only specific Epic (Epic 2 only).

Workaround
There is no workaround.

It is possible to use Jira macro but that does not show the timeline.

Filter for Classic "Epic Link" = MARS-4
Filter for Next gen Parent = ABC-11
fields.summary: Ability to display only selected Epics with Jira roadmap macro on the Confluence page.

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When using the attachments macro on a page, the drag and drop feature does not work or works intermittently.

h4. Steps 
# Create a new page and insert the attachments macro
# Publish the page
# Drag a png image into the page, on the attachments macro

h4. Expected behavior
The image/file will be uploaded into the macro/page

h4. Actual results
The image/file is not uploaded or if it is uploaded on the first try, stops working again, as it seems to be intermittently.
Instead, it opens up the image on the browser window.

h4. Workaround
Use the browse and files images or to drag and drop and upload multiple files, use the upload option on the *page menu  (..) > attachments.*
fields.summary: Upload using the Drag and drop functionality on attachments macro not working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Create page button does not work when the user is redirected from a JSD project to a Space linked to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a JSD project linked with KB space in confluence.
 # Go to the project then Pages/articles.
# Click on 'create article' or 'add page'.
# You will be _redirected to the confluence KB space_.
# Click on *create page* button.
# Select the template and then, click on *create*.
# Nothing would happen, it would be unresponsive.

h3. Expected Results
The page should be created.

h3. Actual Results
The button gets unresponsive.

h3. Workaround
Directly, go to the KB space and create/add the page.
fields.summary: Create page button does not work when the user is redirected from a JSD project

fields.description:
Accounts that are disabled from the site should be removed from people's teams. 

Keeping this in mind that the team is tied up with users, not the site , At least an option while disabling an account there should be a prompt to remove a user from all teams group.
fields.summary: Automatically remove Disabled Accounts from Teams
"Sass" syntax highlighting in code block does not highlight

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to place dynamic variables on Confluence pages. With the implementation of this feature, users would be able to create pages that would provide a custom experience to readers. 

For example, being able to use a variable for $current_user on a page, to display the name of the user who is viewing the page.
fields.summary: Ability to use dynamic variables on pages

fields.description:
Currently, pages created receive a random number for the page ID upon its creation on Confluence Cloud.

It would be useful to have a way to customize the page ID before creating the page.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the page ID on Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to a space template to be a global template, only promote it to be used on a space.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be very useful to have an option to change a space template or all space templates for a specific space to be transformed into global templates for the entire instance.

h3. Workaround
# Edit the space template;
# Copy all of its contents;
# Create a new global template and paste the contents.
fields.summary: Ability to change a space template into a global template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition/Current Behavior

After a page has had several images removed from the body content, these removed images (but not deleted from the view attachments page) are still present on *Attachments* section of the page, however there's no way to tell which images are actually used on the current version of the page. 

Usually on pages that are constantly updated with new images end up with many attachments associated with them, but most of them are no longer useful. 

(This could impact some operations, such as Move and Copy, as Confluence would have to copy all page's attachments, even those that are outdated)

h3. Suggested Behavior

Current attachments should have a different notation, or label, or way to distinguish those from others that are no longer in use. 

Such as being able to sort attachments by Current/Not in use.
fields.summary: Sort attachments that are present in the current version of a page

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We all know that Confluence is about documentation and it is always referred to as "wiki" (even on Confluence's URL). When we are creating spaces on our site, sometimes we think that this is all about another wiki, so why not create it with "wiki" as the spacekey? So, when we perform this action, besides some other functions that might break, the space logo of this space gets broken.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space with *wiki* as the spacekey;
# Go to *Space Settings > Overview > Edit Logo* and upload any image.

h3. Expected Results
The space logo is uploaded and it is shown anywhere in your site.

h3. Actual Results
Though the space logo gets uploaded, it gets broken all over the site.

h3. Workaround
Create a new space with a different spacekey and move/copy your pages to this new space, then delete the remaining one.

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Space logo breaks if spacekey is "wiki"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images are not visible in JSD Portal when include macro is used on the Confluence page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a KB Space link it with the JSD Project.
 # Create two Pages on the KB space. Let say Page A and page B.
# Put the image on page B.
 !image-2020-06-30-18-03-31-078.png|thumbnail! 
# Use the *include macro* on page A to get the image from Page B.

 !image-2020-06-30-18-04-33-127.png|thumbnail! 
# Open the page A on the portal.

h3. Expected Results
The Image should be visible.

h3. Actual Results
The image is broken.
 !image-2020-06-30-18-02-07-233.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images are not visible in JSD Portal when include macro is used on the Confluence page

fields.description: The new confluence archive content functionality is released in beta. To fully start using it with our custom addon and macro cues we need to have the possibility to change page status. Currently, it is not possible to do with API.
fields.summary: Add ability to change content status to archived and back to current with rest API
"CQL was parsed but the search manager was unable to execute the search" error on search API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As I non-SiteAdmin on Confluence. I am able to view all my Forge App and `Manage apps` button. Upon clicking on `Manage apps`, it redirects to an unknown page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to Admin Settings
 # click `Manage apps`

h3. Expected Results
As I non-SiteAdmin on Confluence. I should be able to view all my Forge App. I should not be able to see `Manage apps` button or should be redirected to a page indicating insufficient permissions. I should not be shown a 404.
 
https://share.getcloudapp.com/5zuXLbbG
h3. Workaround

Don't click on `Manage apps`
h3. Actual Results

I should not be sent a 404.
fields.summary: `Manage apps` button redirects to unhandled page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when a page including the [Note macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-info-tip-note-and-warning-macros/] is [exported to PDF|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml/], the size of the macro will be reduced.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit a page.
# Add the [note macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-info-tip-note-and-warning-macros/] with some text.
# Publish the page.
# Export the page to PDF by tapping the page tools at the top right (ellipsis button) and select *Export to PDF*.
# Download the PDF file.

(i) Alternatively, you can export the space to PDF, which will trigger the same phenomenon.

h3. Expected Results
The macro should have the same size from its version on the page.

h3. Actual Results
The macro size is reduced, differently from the other panel macros (e.g. Info, Tip, Warning, Success, and Error), like the example from [this example PDF file|^example.pdf] :
!pdf.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exporting a page to PDF reduces the size of the Note macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Confluence's REST API to copy pages, it won't be possible to publish edits to them.
 It's happening to either single pages or to pages copied in bulk using the {color:#00875a}/rest/api/content/PAGE_ID/copy{color} endpoint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create some pages in the new editor
 # use the [copy page|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-content-id-copy-post] api to copy the pages to another space
 # Try to edit and publish some of the copies

h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to publish edits to the copies
h3. Actual Results

The following error is shown:
{quote}This content cannot be accessed.

Your session may have expired. You'll need to log in again or switch to another account to keep working.
 Log in or switch to another account
{quote}
The request responds with a 404:
{code:none}
Request URL: https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/PAGE_ID/?status=draft&action=publish
Request Method: PUT
Status Code: 404 

Payload:
{
    "id": "33687092",
    "type": "page",
    "title": "Page7",
    "space":
    {
        "key": "LSCA"
    },
    "body":
    {
        "editor":
        {
            "value": "{\"type\":\"doc\",\"content\":[{\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"content\":[{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Test page\"}]}],\"version\":1}",
            "representation": "atlas_doc_format",
            "content":
            {
                "id": "33687092"
            }
        }
    },
    "status": "current",
    "version":
    {
        "number": 2,
        "message": "",
        "minorEdit": false,
        "syncRev": "0.1J5gwnHlridgfWJNgrBCmw.0"
    }
}

Response:
{
    "statusCode": 404,
    "data":
    {
        "authorized": false,
        "valid": true,
        "errors": [],
        "successful": false
    },
    "message": "com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.NotFoundException: null"
}{code}
h3. Notes
 * This also happens when copying a single page using the same endpoint

h3. Workaround

Option A:
 # Edit the page
 # Click on *•••* and select *View Changes*
 # Close the changes dialog and *Publish* the page

Option B:
 # Create a new bookmark to any page in your browser.
 # Edit the bookmark: change name to 'Fix page' (or any other suitable name) and change address to the following:
{code:java}
javascript:fetch('/wiki/rest/tinymce/1/content/' + /pages(\/[\w-]+)?\/(\d+)/g.exec(location.href)[2] + '/draft/diff').then(() => console.log('Page fixed')).catch(() => console.log('Error'));
{code}
 # Save the bookmark. For convenience move it to some easily accessible place (for example Bookmarks Bar in Chrome).
 # Navigate to the page that you can't edit and invoke the added bookmark. You should now be able to edit the page.

Option C:
 # Navigate to the page that you can't edit and open Developer Tools (Chrome), Web Inspector (Safari) or the alternative in your browser.
 # In the Developer Tools open Console.
 # Paste the following code to the console and press Enter:
{code:java}
fetch('/wiki/rest/tinymce/1/content/' + /pages(\/[\w-]+)?\/(\d+)/g.exec(location.href)[2] + '/draft/diff').then(() => console.log('Page fixed')).catch(() => console.log('Error'));
{code}
 # You should see the "Page fixed" message, and after that you should be able to edit the page.
fields.summary: Can't publish edits to pages copied with the API

fields.description:
I think it would be a good idea to have a bolded box or allow the user to have individual shades of the same color to signify different types of bars in one lane. 

This would allow one project per lane to have several significant events of the same caliber.
fields.summary: Roadmap planner new bar individual color change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#DEEBFF}
*Atlassian Update as of Jul. 24, 2020*
This issue has been fixed. It was a regression caused by a search backend technical update we have been rolling out progressively. This is the final update for this ticket.
Please note that the fix brought back functional parity with the previous experience meant to handle multi-word phrases separated by space. For exact match use cases involving symbols and stop words, please watch feature suggestion [CONFCLOUD-69222|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-69222] instead.

Thank you for your patience,
Elaine Hankins, Confluence Cloud Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary
Using double quotes to search for a phrase in confluence results in irrelevant articles along with the right ones.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a phrase written inside eg "This is Test", "Hello World"
 # Create a page with a title of the same phrase. Use the advanced search option to enter the phrase in double-quotes.
 # [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-search-syntax-158720.html]

h3. Expected Results
It should only search for the pages containing this phrase or title.

h3. Actual Results

It considers every single word to search. 

Please note: Considering the imitations with the exact match search in Confluence where 
 Confluence ignores common words (stop words) and 
 Phrases with special characters
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using double quotes for search of phrase find lot of results.

fields.description:
I've been trying to add all my releases and program events to the calendar view so I can view it in a timeline. Our release dates change very often. I've noticed that your calendar isn't "smart" to where I can search for the event and change the date for it right away. I'd have to scroll until I find it and then change from there. 

I think this would be a good option to have.
fields.summary: Smart Calendar

fields.description: I currently have several roadmap planners on the same page but after discussion with my team, we've all agreed it'd be easier to view them all in one. I will now have to create another page and add all lanes to one roadmap. This will double the work effort.
fields.summary: Allow Roadmap Planners to be merged into one

Currently, when Confluence sends a notification e-mail, the name of the author/ modifier is included in the "From" field.

Remove this field, leaving just the instance's name.
fields.summary: Remove names from the "from" field on e-mail notifications
